node.title: This tiny boy was never expected to survive. Watch him take his first steps
node.description: Born at 23 weeks, doctors moved baby Isaiah's family into the stillborn ward to say their goodbyes. Thirteen months later, the little boy continues to defy the odds.
node.content:
["When her water broke at 20 weeks,\u00a0Jillian Martin was moved into Mount Isa Hospital's stillborn ward so she could prepare to say goodbye.", "Thirteen months later, her \"miracle'\" boy, Isaiah, continues to defy the odds as he takes his first steps.", "The North West\u00a0Queensland mum and her husband, Dan, want to shed a light on the challenges faced by families with premature babies and give hope to those in similar situations.", "After four threatened miscarriages, doctors told the Martins to prepare for the worst \u2014 no baby, they said,\u00a0had ever survived a birth at less than 21 weeks.", "\"They said my son was going to be stillborn, because you've got about a 98 per cent chance of going into labour after your water breaks,\" Mrs Martin said.", "", "
Mrs Martin couldn't believe how small baby Isaiah was when she first held him.(Supplied: Jillian Martin)
", "But not only did Mrs Martin not go into labour, further tests revealed her baby was surviving.", "\"I still had a bit of fluid left, albeit on the lower side of normal,\" she said.", "\"As they carried out more checks, the baby's heartbeat was fine.\"", "Mrs Martin was able to carry her son for a further three weeks before she was flown to Townsville University Hospital.", "\"They were the longest weeks of my life,\" she said.", "
Grim prognosis
", "On arrival in Townsville, Mr and Mrs Martin were dealt another blow \u2014 they were told Isaiah was expected to be born brain dead.", "", "
Isaiah's father, Dan Martin, carefully cleaning his tiny baby boy.(Supplied: Jillian Martin)
", "\"That was hard,\" Mrs Martin said.", "The clinical beeping of monitors and the bitter smell of antiseptic are ingrained in Mrs Martin's memory of the Townsville neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) that she called home for four months.", "\"It got very overwhelming very quickly,\" she said.", "\"But one of the best experiences we had was with the hospital staff \u2014 whether it was in Mount Isa or Townsville, we had so much help and people were so generous with their time.\"", "
The birth
", "On a Wednesday night, Mrs Martin went into labour at little more than\u00a023 weeks' gestation.", "", "
Jillian Martin with baby Isaiah during a \"kangaroo cuddle\" session, where mum and bub get important skin-to-skin contact.(Supplied: Jillian Martin)
", "Isaiah was born weighing just 700 grams.", "\"After it was all done, I was standing in the NICU looking at him and I just couldn't believe how small he was,\" she said.", "\"You have so much doubt running through your head \u2014 'How is something this small going to survive?'", "But after four months of daily hospital trips, blood transfusions, steroid doses and weight examinations,\u00a0Isaiah and his family were ready to go home.", "
Not out of the woods
", "Mrs Martin recalled the anxiety that came from not being able to rely on the monitoring devices to which Isaiah was attached.", "\"I missed those beeping noises,\" she said.", "", "
Mrs Martin says she could all but hear ants crawling on the family's first night at home together.(Supplied: Jillian Martin)
", "One night, Isaiah's lungs partially collapsed.", "It was confirmed he had respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) and human metapneumovirus (HMPV).", "\"Doctors said the two viruses on top of each other should have killed him,\" she said.", "Nevertheless, after three weeks in intensive care, Isaiah was \"back to normal\".", "\"The doctors were just astounded,\" Mrs Martin said.", "\"They said he had defied all the odds, and as he's grown, he's continued to surprise us.\"", "", "
Baby Isaiah wearing his first Christmas outfit in hospital (left) and enjoying a day out in his cowboy boots at 13 months' old.(Supplied: Jillian Martin)
", "
'Miracles can happen'
", "Now, at 13 months old, Isaiah is lovingly described by his mum as \"a little terror\".", "While he lives with high-functioning cerebral palsy, retinopathy of prematurity (eye disease), and chronic lung disease, he is not letting that stop him from taking his first steps.", "As the Martins look forward to full lives ahead with their two young boys, they're raising awareness about the experiences of preterm families on World Prematurity Day.", "Each year, 15 million babies are born premature worldwide, including more than 27,000 in Australia.", "\"Yes, things happen in pregnancy and it's not always straightforward,\" Mrs Martin said.", "\"But sometimes it's not a death sentence and miracles can happen.\""]
